statement.tex: \text{Let }\ora{a}=\vector{1}{4}{2}, \ora{b}=\vector{3}{-2}{7} \\ \text{and }\ora{c}=\vector{2}{-1}{4}.\text{ Find a vector}\ora{d} \\ \text{which is perpendicular to both $\ora{a}$ and $\ora{b}$} \\ \text{and }\ora{c}\cdot \ora{d}=15.

step.context: \text{If }\ora{d}=\vector{d_1}{d_2}{d_3}\text{ and }\ora{c}=\vector{2}{-1}{4} \\ \text{ and $\ora{c}\cdot\ora{d}=15$ is the following valid?}
\text{If }\begin{align} d_1+4d_2+2d_3 &= 0 \\ 3d_1-2d_2+7d_3 &= 0 \\ 2d_1-d_2+4d_3&=15 \end{align}\text{ and } \\ \ora{d}=\vector{d_1}{d_2}{d_3}, \text{ is the following correct?}
step.reason: \begin{align} d_1+4d_2+2d_3 = 0 &\quad (1)\\ 3d_1-2d_2+7d_3 = 0 &\quad (2)\\ 2d_1-d_2+4d_3=15 &\quad (3) \end{align} \\ \text{Use equation (3), } d_2=2d_1+4d_3-15 \\ \text{Substitute $d_2$ in equations (1) and (2),} \\ \begin{align} 3d_1+6d_3 &= 20 \\ d_1+d_3 &= 30 \end{align} \\ \text{On solving, we get } \ora{d}=\dfrac{1}{3}\left(\vector{160}{-5}{-70}\right)
